measured_by: Sliding-scale future share price estimates at 1-day, 2-week and 1-year horizons
justification: "Participants were then asked to predict the future trajectory of the price, at intervals of one-day, two-weeks, and one-year… Ratings were made on a sliding scale centered at the current price, and ranging from 50% less than the current price up to 50% more."

measured_by: 0–100 % probability rating to include security in portfolio
justification: In Experiment 2, "participants were asked to … rate the probability that they would include the security in a portfolio they were constructing."  These ratings were "on a scale from 0 % to 100 %."

topic_or_construct: Approach vs. avoidance emotions toward securities
measured_by: Checklist of 20 approach and 20 avoidance emotion words (net score)
justification: Experiment 3 had participants "check all that apply" from "a list of 20 avoidance emotions … and 20 approach emotions," afterwards computing a net approach-minus-avoidance score.
The study collected "self-reported measures of financial knowledge, from 0 ('Very little knowledge') to 10 ('Extensive knowledge')."
Participants also gave "self-reported measures of investment experience, from 0 ('Very little experience') to 10 ('Extensive experience')."

measured_by: Dummy-coded indicators for finance courses taken, ownership of financial assets, and business major
justification: The expertise battery "included objective questions about financial assets, courses, and major," which were later treated as dummy-coded variables in the analyses.
